WonderkidAnswered on 10 Sep 2018Hi there,​We recommend that customers spread out large investments across several months, investing through dollar-cost-averaging (https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/dollarcostaveraging.asp) and holding assets until your goal is reachedBy investing a fixed dollar amount on a regular schedule, regardless of market conditions, you will purchase more shares when prices are low and fewer shares when prices are high. This ensures that you will invest at a reasonable price and exchange rate, and avoid investing at market tops, helping you to manage the risk of your investments. ​Your risk level should depend on your risk appetite and not just on returns. You can read an article we recently posted here: https://www.stashaway.sg/r/debunking-high-risk-high-return.
